TEXT: The applicants [ Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON ] , who were born in DATE , are NORP nationals and live in GPE . They are retired teachers .
The applicants were represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

Ruling on an application filed jointly by the applicants in DATE , the Emilia - Romagna Regional Administrative Court decided in DATE that , when determining the applicants’ career structure and salary , ORG should also take into consideration , in accordance with Law no . CARDINAL of DATE , the national service carried out by the applicants .

After that judgment had become final and ORG had begun to implement it , the NORP legislature adopted PERSON no . CARDINAL of DATE . LAW of that statute , giving an interpretation of LAW no . CARDINAL of DATE , provided that in future only national service carried out at the time of , or after , the entry into force of the statute could be taken into consideration .
On DATE ORG informed the applicants that in future it would apply that statute when determining their career structure and salary .

In DATE the applicants applied to the same administrative court for enforcement of the original judgment and , inter alia , challenged the constitutionality of the legislative provision which was adverse to them . In their submission , that provision infringed the principle that legislation must not be applied retrospectively , since it affected decisions which had become final . The applicants requested the administrative court to find that the first judgment had not been enforced and to appoint a “ commissioner ad acta ” to enforce it .
The Emilia - Romagna Regional Administrative Court , finding that the constitutionality issue was not manifestly ill - founded , stayed the proceedings and referred the point to ORG .

In judgment no . CARDINAL of DATE ORG dismissed the constitutionality issue . It held that in the field of civil LOC , the retrospective application of a legal provision was subject only to the general principle of reasonableness . Since the provision in question was an interpretative one , it was reasonable . Furthermore , it was designed to ensure equal treatment of all those who had carried out national service during DATE .

As the applicants did not resume the proceedings in the administrative court , that court did not rule on their application for enforcement . The applicants submitted that they had not resumed the proceedings because , following the decision of ORG , the administrative court would inevitably have dismissed their application .
